title: Hypotheses
text: What are the Null Hypothesis $$H_0$$ and Alternative Hypothesis in this context?

hintAnswer: $$H_0$$: The absent days occur with equal frequencies, that is, they fit a uniform distribution.
title: Null Hypothesis
text: Choose the answer from the following.
choices: $$H_0$$: The absent days occur with equal frequencies, that is, they fit a uniform distribution.
$$H_0$$: The absent days occur with unequal frequencies, that is, they do not fit a uniform distribution.

hintAnswer: $$H_a$$: The absent days occur with unequal frequencies, that is, they do not fit a uniform distribution.
title: Alternative Hypothesis
text: Choose the answer from the following.
choices: $$H_a$$: The absent days occur with equal frequencies, that is, they fit a uniform distribution.
$$H_a$$: The absent days occur with unequal frequencies, that is, they do not fit a uniform distribution.

title: Consider what distribution is most appropriate to use in this problem.
What is the degree of freedom?
Compute the $$p-value$$, P(X**2 > 3)
text: Round the answer to three decimal places.\n##figure2.gif##

title: Compare with the significant level $$0.05$$.
text: At 5% significance level, \alpha $$=$$ $$0.05$$. For this data, \alpha < P. Do not reject the null hypothesis.

title: Interpret the Result
text: At a 5% level of significance, from the sample data, there is not sufficient evidence to conclude that the absent days do not occur with equal frequencies.
